00001 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
00002 
00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: Datum Library
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides datum shifts for a large collection of local
00009  *    datums, WGS72, and WGS84.  A particular datum can be accessed by using its
00010  *    standard 5-letter code to find its index in the datum table.  The index
00011  *    can then be used to retrieve the name, type, ellipsoid code, and datum
00012  *    shift parameters, and to perform shifts to or from that datum.
00013  *
00014  *    By sequentially retrieving all of the datum codes and/or names, a menu
00015  *    of the available datums can be constructed.  The index values resulting
00016  *    from selections from this menu can then be used to access the parameters
00017  *    of the selected datum, or to perform datum shifts involving that datum.
00018  *
00019  *    This component supports both 3-parameter local datums, for which only X,
00020  *    Y, and Z translations relative to WGS 84 have been defined, and
00021  *    7-parameter local datums, for which X, Y, and Z rotations, and a scale
00022  *    factor, are also defined.  It also includes entries for WGS 84 (with an
00023  *    index of 0), and WGS 72 (with an index of 1), but no shift parameter
00024  *    values are defined for these.
00025  *
00026  *    This component provides datum shift functions for both geocentric and
00027  *    geodetic coordinates.  WGS84 is used as an intermediate state when
00028  *    shifting from one local datum to another.  When geodetic coordinates are
00029  *    given Molodensky's method is used, except near the poles where the 3-step
00030  *    step method is used instead.  Specific algorithms are used for shifting
00031  *    between WGS72 and WGS84.
00032  *
00033  *    This component depends on two data files, named 3_param.dat and
00034  *    7_param.dat, which contain the datum parameter values.  Copies of these
00035  *    files must be located in the directory specified by the value of the
00036  *    environment variable "MSPCCS_DATA", if defined, or else in the current
00037  *    directory whenever a program containing this component is executed.
00038  *
00039  *    Additional datums can be added to these files, either manually or using
00040  *    the Create_Datum function.  However, if a large number of datums are
00041  *    added, the datum table array sizes in this component will have to be
00042  *    increased.
00043  *
00044  *    This component depends on two other components: the Ellipsoid component
00045  *    for access to ellipsoid parameters; and the Geocentric component for
00046  *    conversions between geodetic and geocentric coordinates.
00047  *
00048  * ERROR HANDLING
00049  *
00050  *    This component checks for input file errors and input parameter errors.
00051  *    If an invalid value is found, the error code is combined with the current
00052  *    error code using the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error
00053  *    codes to be returned. The possible error codes are:
00054  *
00055  *  DATUM_NO_ERROR                  : No errors occurred in function
00056  *  DATUM_NOT_INITIALIZED_ERROR     : Datum module has not been initialized
00057  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 7 parameter file opening error
00058  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 7 parameter file structure error
00059  *  DATUM_7PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 7 parameter table overflow
00060  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 3 parameter file opening error
00061  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 3 parameter file structure error
00062  *  DATUM_3PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 3 parameter table overflow
00063  *  DATUM_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR       : Index out of valid range (less than one
00064  *                                      or more than Number_of_Datums)
00065  *  DATUM_INVALID_SRC_INDEX_ERROR   : Source datum index invalid
00066  *  DATUM_INVALID_DEST_INDEX_ERROR  : Destination datum index invalid
00067  *  DATUM_INVALID_CODE_ERROR        : Datum code not found in table
00068  *  DATUM_LAT_ERROR                 : Latitude out of valid range (-90 to 90)
00069  *  DATUM_LON_ERROR                 : Longitude out of valid range (-180 to
00070  *                                    360)
00071  *  DATUM_SIGMA_ERROR               : Standard error values must be positive
00072  *                                    (or -1 if unknown)
00073  *  DATUM_DOMAIN_ERROR              : Domain of validity not well defined
00074  *  DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR             : Error in ellipsoid module
00075  *  DATUM_NOT_USERDEF_ERROR         : Datum code is not user defined - cannot
00076  *                                    be deleted
00077  *
00078  *
00079  * REUSE NOTES
00080  *
00081  *    Datum is intended for reuse by any application that needs access to
00082  *    datum shift parameters relative to WGS 84.
00083  *
00084  *
00085  * REFERENCES
00086  *
00087  *    Further information on Datum can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00088  *
00089  *    Datum originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center (USATEC)
00090  *                             Geospatial Information Division (GID)
00091  *                             7701 Telegraph Road
00092  *                             Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00093  *
00094  * LICENSES
00095  *
00096  *    None apply to this component.
00097  *
00098  * RESTRICTIONS
00099  *
00100  *    Datum has no restrictions.
00101  *
00102  * ENVIRONMENT
00103  *
00104  *    Datum was tested and certified in the following environments:
00105  *
00106  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00107  *    2. MS Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ 6
00108  *
00109  * MODIFICATIONS
00110  *
00111  *    Date              Description
00112  *    ----              -----------
00113  *    11/20/08          Original Code
00114  */
00115 
00116

00139 DatumLibrary::DatumLibrary( DatumLibraryImplementation* __datumLibraryImplementation )
00140 {
00141 /*
00142  * The constructor creates an empty list to store the datum information
00143  *  contained in two external files, 3_param.dat and 7_param.dat.  
00144  */
00145 
00146   _datumLibraryImplementation = __datumLibraryImplementation;
00147 }

00162 DatumLibrary& DatumLibrary::operator=( const DatumLibrary &dl )

00164   if ( &dl == this )
00165           return *this;

00167   _datumLibraryImplementation = dl._datumLibraryImplementation;
00168 
00169   return *this;

00173 void DatumLibrary::defineDatum( const int datumType, const char *datumCode, const char *datumName, const char *ellipsoidCode,
00174                                 double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ,
00175                                 double sigmaX, double sigmaY,  double sigmaZ,
00176                                 double westLongitude, double eastLongitude, double southLatitude, double northLatitude,
00177                                 double rotationX, double rotationY,  double rotationZ, double scaleFactor)
00178 {
00179 /* The function defineDatum creates a new local (3 or 7-parameter) datum with the
00180  * specified code, name, shift values, and standard error values or rotation and scale factor values.  
00181  * If the datum table has not been initialized, the specified code is already in use,
00182  * or a new version of the 3-param.dat or 7-param.dat file cannot be created, an 
00183  * exception is thrown.  Note that the indexes
00184  * of all datums in the datum table may be changed by this function.
00185  *
00186  *   datumType     : Specifies 3 parameter or 7 parameter datum    (input)
00187  *   datumCode     : 5-letter new datum code.                      (input)
00188  *   datumName     : Name of the new datum                         (input)
00189  *   ellipsoidCode : 2-letter code for the associated ellipsoid    (input)
00190  *   deltaX        : X translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00191  *   deltaY        : Y translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00192  *   deltaZ        : Z translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00193  *   sigmaX        : Standard error in X in meters                 (input)
00194  *   sigmaY        : Standard error in Y in meters                 (input)
00195  *   sigmaZ        : Standard error in Z in meters                 (input)
00196  *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00197  *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00198  *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00199  *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00200  *   rotationX     : X rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00201  *   rotationY     : Y rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00202  *   rotationZ     : Z rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00203  *   scalefactor   : Scale factor                                  (input)
00204  *
00205  */
00206  
00207   if( datumType == DatumType::threeParamDatum )
00208   {
00209     _datumLibraryImplementation->define3ParamDatum( datumCode, datumName, ellipsoidCode,
00210                                deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, sigmaX, sigmaY, sigmaZ,
00211                                westLongitude, eastLongitude, southLatitude, northLatitude );
00212   }
00213   else if( datumType == DatumType::sevenParamDatum )
00214   {
00215     _datumLibraryImplementation->define7ParamDatum( datumCode, datumName, ellipsoidCode,
00216                                deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ, rotationX, rotationY, rotationZ,
00217                                scaleFactor );
00218   }
00219 }
00220 
00221 
00222 void DatumLibrary::removeDatum( const char* code )
00223 { 
00224 /*
00225  * The function removeDatum deletes a local (3-parameter) datum with the
00226  * specified code.  If the datum table has not been initialized or a new
00227  * version of the 3-param.dat file cannot be created, an error code is returned,
00228  * otherwise DATUM_NO_ERROR is returned.  Note that the indexes of all datums
00229  * in the datum table may be changed by this function.
00230  *
00231  *   code           : 5-letter datum code.                      (input)
00232  *
00233  */
00234 
00235   _datumLibraryImplementation->removeDatum( code );
00236 }

00239 void DatumLibrary::getDatumCount( long *count )
00240 { 
00241 /*
00242  *  The function datumCount returns the number of Datums in the table
00243  *  if the table was initialized without error.
00244  *
00245  *  count        : number of datums in the datum table     (output)
00246  */
00247 
00248   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumCount( count );
00249 }

00251 
00252 void DatumLibrary::getDatumIndex( const char *code, long *index )
00253 { 
00254 /*
00255  *  The function datumIndex returns the index of the datum with the
00256  *  specified code.
00257  *
00258  *  code    : The datum code being searched for.                    (input)
00259  *  index   : The index of the datum in the table with the          (output)
00260  *              specified code.
00261  */
00262 
00263   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumIndex( code, index );
00264 } 
00265 
00266 
00267 void DatumLibrary::getDatumInfo( const long index, char *code, char *name, char *ellipsoidCode )
00268 { 
00269 /*
00270  *  The function getDatumInfo returns the 5-letter code, name and
00271  *  2-letter ellipsoid code of the datum referenced by index.
00272  *
00273  *  index            : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00274  *  code             : The datum Code of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00275  *  name             : The datum Name of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00276  *  ellipsoidCode    : The ellipsoid code for the ellipsoid associated with  (output)
00277  *                     the datum referenced by index.
00278  */
00279 
00280   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumCode( index, code );
00281   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumName( index, name );
00282   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumEllipsoidCode( index, ellipsoidCode );
00283 } 
00284 
00285 
00286 void DatumLibrary::getDatumParameters( const long index, DatumType::Enum *datumType, double *deltaX, double *deltaY, double *deltaZ,
00287                                        double *sigmaX, double *sigmaY, double *sigmaZ,
00288                                        double *westLongitude, double *eastLongitude, double *southLatitude, double *northLatitude,
00289                                        double *rotationX, double *rotationY, double *rotationZ, double *scaleFactor )
00290 { 
00291 /*
00292  *   The function datumErrors returns the standard errors in X,Y, & Z
00293  *   for the datum referenced by index.
00294  *
00295  *    index      : The index of a given datum in the datum table   (input)
00296  *    sigma_X    : Standard error in X in meters                   (output)
00297  *    sigma_Y    : Standard error in Y in meters                   (output)
00298  *    sigma_Z    : Standard error in Z in meters                   (output)
00299  */
00300 
00301   _datumLibraryImplementation->retrieveDatumType( index, datumType );
00302   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumTranslationValues( index, deltaX, deltaY, deltaZ );
00303   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumStandardErrors( index, sigmaX, sigmaY, sigmaZ );
00304   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumValidRectangle( index, westLongitude, eastLongitude, southLatitude, northLatitude );
00305   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumSevenParameters( index, rotationX, rotationY, rotationZ, scaleFactor );
00306 } 
00307 
00308 
00309 void DatumLibrary::getDatumValidRectangle( const long index, double *westLongitude, double *eastLongitude, double *southLatitude, double *northLatitude )
00310 {
00311 /*
00312  *   The function datumValidRectangle returns the edges of the validity
00313  *   rectangle for the datum referenced by index.
00314  *
00315  *   index          : The index of a given datum in the datum table   (input)
00316  *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians   (output)
00317  *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians   (output)
00318  *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians  (output)
00319  *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians  (output)
00320  *
00321  */
00322 
00323   _datumLibraryImplementation->datumValidRectangle( index, westLongitude, eastLongitude, southLatitude, northLatitude );
00324 }
